name: ARTICLE_NAME
label: Enter the study name as used in tables or text in the meta-analysis. Alternatively: PDF file name.

name: ARTICLE_DOI
label: DOI of article (if no DOI, include http:// to the study. If not online, leave empty).

name: CODED_BY
label: ORCID or full name

name: COAUTHORED
Description: Control question to make sure coders don't code papers they (co-)authored
label:
### (Co-)Authorship
Did you author or co-author this article or were you involved in the conception or execution of the research described in it?

name: GENERAL_NONPREREG
Description: Does the article contain non-preregistered studies?
label: Does the article contain non-preregistered studies, including pilot studies?

name: GENERAL_NONPREREG_COUNT
Description: If the article contains non-preregistered studies, how many?
label: How many?

name: GENERAL_NONPREREG_COMMENTS
label: Any comments regarding non-preregistered studies:

name: STUDY_NO
Description: ID number of study, if more than one study is reported in the article
label: Number (1, 2a, 2b, etc. 1 for single study papers. Copy naming convention from papers (e.g., Study 4a and 4b)., but translate into numerical variable: So Study 1 a and 1b are 1.1 and 1.2

name: STUDY_META_ANALYSIS
Description: Is the study a meta-analysis or a systematic review?
label: Is the study a meta-analysis or a systematic review?

name: HYP_NO
Description: ID number of hypothesis, if more than one confirmatory hypothesis is analysed in the study
label: Number (1, 2, 3, â€¦), restricted to confirmatory hypotheses. Copy naming convention from papers (e.g., Hypothesis 2a and 2b), but translate into numerical variable: So Hypothesis 1a and 1b are 1.1 and 1.2

name: HYP_QUOTE
label:
### Hypothesis quote
Copy-paste the text which states _this_ hypothesis.
Try to find the quote with the most clear, unambiguous statement of the hypothesis.
If no hypothesis is reported, code "not reported"

name: HYP_PAGE
label:
### Page number of the hypothesis quote
If no hypothesis is reported, code "NA"

name: HYP_DIRECTION
Description: Is the hypothesis directional?
Answer options:
directional
non-directional
absence of effect
compound (more than one effect)
other
label:
Is the hypothesis directional (authors predict the sign of an effect, e.g. group A > group B, negative correlation)?
directional effect = hypothesis predicts the sign of the effect
non-directional effect = hypothesis predicts an effect without specifying the direction
absence of an effect = hypothesis predicts that an effect is zero or closer to zero than some criterion
compound = hypothesis relates to more than one effect (e.g. "A > B *and* C = D")

name: HYP_DIRECTION_OTHER
Description: Specification of "other" type of hypothesis
label: Please explain:

name: HYP_DEPEND
Description: Is the hypothesis independent of other hypotheses in the article?
label: Is the hypothesis independent from all other (confirmatory) hypotheses in this study?

name: HYP_DEPEND_SPEC
Description: Specification of relation to other hypotheses, if dependent on other hypotheses
label:
Please specify any dependencies between this and other hypotheses in the study (report the exact numbers of any dependent hypotheses).
For example, the hypothesis could be the complement of another hypothesis (predict the opposite outcome), or it could be the precondition for another hypothesis.

name: HYP_CODING_DIFFICULTY
Description: How difficult was it to code this hypothesis?
label:
### Hypothesis coding difficulty
How difficult was it to code this hypothesis?

name: HYP_COMMENTS
label:
### Hypothesis comments
Any comments regarding (the coding of) this hypothesis?

name: HYP_REPLICATION
Description: Is the hypothesis part of a replication attempt?
label: Is this hypothesis part of a replication attempt?

name: HYP_REPLICATION_TYPE_TAX
label: ![replication_taxonomy](http://www.curatescience.org/logos/replication-taxonomy-v4_small.png)"

name: HYP_REPLICATION_TYPE
Description: If the hypothesis is not original: Classification according to the Curate Science replication taxonomy
Answer options:
exact replication
very close replication
close replication
far replication
very far replication
label:
# Replication type
Please consider the replication taxonomy shown above and classify the type of replication from "exact" to "very far".

name: HYP_REPLICATION_QUOTE
Description: Quote of the description of the replication type
label:
# Replication description quote
Please copy-paste the authors' description of the type of replication (e.g. close replication, conceptual replication)

name: HYP_REPLICATION_QUOTE_PAGE
label: Page number of the replication description quote

name: HYP_METHOD_LENGTH
label: Method section word count

name: RESULT_NO
Description: Only relevant if the hypothesis relates to more than one analysis/result
label:
Result number:
If the hypothesis relates to more than one result, please number the results consecutively.

name: RESULT_QUOTE
label:
# Result quote
Copy-paste the text containing the test result. If the result is reported in a table or figure and *not* in the text, state the table of figure instead (e.g., "Table 4", "Figure 1A").
Priority is as follows:
1. Try to find a quote from the text. 
If there is none >
2. Try to find a table containing the result. 
If there is none >
3. Try to find a figure containing the result. 
If there is none >
4. Code "not reported"

name: RESULT_PAGE
label:
Page number of the result quote
(or of the table or figure)
If no result is reported, code "NA".

name: RESULT_TYPE
Description: Whether the used analysis is frequentist or Bayesian, and whether a testing or estimation approach is used
Answer options:
frequentist test
Bayesian test
frequentist estimation
Bayesian estimation
other
label:
What kind of analysis was used?
(Select all that apply)

name: RESULT_TYPE_OTHER
Description: Specify the type of analysis, if it is not frequentist or Bayesian testing or estimation or both
label: Please explain:

name: RESULT_CRIT_ALPHA_REPORT
Description: Whether or not the used alpha level is made explicit
label: Is the used alpha level made explicit?

name: RESULT_CRIT_ALPHA
Description: The used alpha level
label: What is the alpha level?

name: RESULT_CRIT_BAYES
Description: Whether or not a Bayesian decision criterion is reported
label: Is a Bayesian decision criterion specified?

name: RESULT_CRIT_BAYES_TYPE
label: What kind of decision criterion?

name: RESULT_CRIT_BF
Description: If a Bayes factor cutoff is used: value
label: Specify the Bayes-factor cutoff:

name: RESULT_CRIT_BF_OTHER
Description: Specification of other Bayesian decision criteria
label: Please explain:

name: RESULT_TESTSTAT
Answer options:
t
F
r
Chi-square
z
other
not reported
NA
label: Which test statistic is used?

name: RESULT_TESTSTAT_OTHER
label: Please specify:

name: RESULT_TESTVAL
label: Test value:

name: RESULT_TESTDF1
label: DF 1:

name: RESULT_TESTDF2
label: DF 2:

name: RESULT_PVAL
Description: How is the p value reported?
Answer options:
exact
smaller than
greater than
"not significant"
not reported
NA
label: How is the *p* value reported?

name: RESULT_PVAL_EXACT
Description: exact p value
label: *p* =

name: RESULT_PVAL_SMALLER
Description: p smaller than, if reported as p smaller than
label: *p* <

name: RESULT_PVAL_LARGER
Description: p greater than, if reported as p greater than
label: *p* >

name: RESULT_N
Description: Number of subjects used for this analysis
label: How many subjects were included in this analysis?

name: RESULT_SAMPLE_SOURCE
Description: Was the data new or pre-existing?
label: Was the data collected for this study or did it already exist?

name: RESULT_SAMPLE_PREEXIST
Description: Source of the data if it was pre-existing
label: Please specify the source of the data:

name: RESULT_SAMPLE_DEPEND
Description: Does the sample overlap with samples of other analyses in the article?
label: Does the sample that gave this result overlap fully or partly with the sample used for another analysis of this hypothesis or another hypothesis in this article?

name: RESULT_SAMPLE_DEPEND_SPEC
Description: Specify overlap with other samples
label: Please state exactly with which results from which hypothesis the sample overlaps, and how (e.g. if the sample is identical or what the differences are)

name: RESULT_SAMPLE_EXCLUDED
Description: Were participants excluded from the analysis?
label: Were participants excluded from this analysis?

name: RESULT_SAMPLE_EXCLUDED_PREREG
Description: Were all reasons for exclusion preregistered?
label: Were all reasons for exclusion preregistered?

name: RESULT_COND_BETWEEN
Description: Number of between-subject conditions
label: How many between-subjects conditions were used?

name: RESULT_COND_WITHIN
Description: Number of within-subject conditions
label: How many within-subjects conditions were used?

name: RESULT_EFF_REPORT
Description: Is an effect size reported?
label: Is the effect size reported?

name: RESULT_EFF_PARAM_t
Description: Effect size parameter for t statistics
Answer options:
Cohen's d
raw mean difference
other
label: What effect size parameter is reported?

name: RESULT_EFF_PARAM_F
Description: Effect size parameter for F statistics
Answer options:
eta squared
partial eta squared
omega squared
f
other
label: What effect size parameter is reported?

name: RESULT_EFF_PARAM_r
Description: Effect size parameter for r statistics
label: What effect size parameter is reported?

name: RESULT_EFF_PARAM_Chi_z
Description: Effect size parameter for Chi-square statistics
label: What effect size parameter is reported?

name: RESULT_EFF_PARAM_OTHER
Description: Effect size parameter if none of the above
label: What effect size parameter is reported?

name: RESULT_EFF_CALC
Variable: Other values to calculate effect size
Description: Values to calculate effect size if no test statistic or effect size is reported
label: Report any data that could be used to calculate the effect size (e.g. means, SDs, group sizes):

name: RESULT_BAYES
Description: Type of Bayesian analysis (if a Bayesian analysis is used)
label: Please explain the type of Bayesian analysis that is used:

name: RESULT_BF
Description: Whether or not a Bayes factor is reported
label: Is a Bayes factor reported?

name: RESULT_BF_PRIOR_H0
Description: Type of H0 prior, if a Bayes factor is reported
label: What prior is used for H0?

name: RESULT_BF_PRIOR_H0_OTHER
Variable: H0 prior if other than point null
Description: Specification of H0 prior if other than a point null
label: Please specify the shape, mean, and width (if applicable) of the H0 prior:

name: RESULT_BF_PRIOR_H1
Description: Specification of H1 prior, if a Bayes factor is reported
label: Please specify the shape, mean, and width (if applicable) of the H1 prior:

name: RESULT_BF_ORDER
Description: Is the Bayes factor reported as BF10 or BF01?
label: Is the Bayes factor reported as BF10 or BF01?

name: RESULT_BF_ORDER_OTHER
Variable: BF other than BF10 or BF01
Description: Specification of Bayes factor reporting, if not BF10 or BF01
label: Please specify:

name: RESULT_BF_VALUE
label: BF =

name: RESULT_BAYES_PRIORS
Description: Any other/additional information about used priors
label: Please give any additional information about used priors, prior probabilities, or prior odds, that have not been coded so far:

name: RESULT_BAYES_POST
Description: Any other/additional information about reported Bayesian outcomes/posterior probabilities
label: Please give any additional information about Bayesian outcomes that have not been coded so far:

name: RESULT_CODING_DIFFICULTY
Description: How difficult was it to code this result?
label:
# Result coding difficulty
How difficult was it to code this result?

name: RESULT_COMMENTS
label:
# Result comments
Any comments regarding (the coding of) this result?

name: CONCLUSION_QUOTE
label:
# Conclusion quote
Copy-paste the text containing the conclusion _for this hypothesis_.
Try to find the quote with the most clear, unambiguous statement about the conclusion.
If there are several equally clear, unambiguous statements, choose the one that is most specific for this hypothesis.
If there is no conclusion statement, code "not reported"

name: CONCLUSION_PAGE
label:
# Page number of the conclusion quote
If there is no conclusion statement, code "NA"

name: CONCLUSION_TYPE
Description: Is the hypothesis directional?
Answer options:
confirmed
disconfirmed
inconclusive
not reported
not codeable
other
label:
# Conclusion
What was the authors' conclusion _for this hypothesis_?

name: CONCLUSION_CODING_DIFFICULTY
Description: How difficult was it to code this conclusion?
label:
# Result coding difficulty
How difficult was it to code this result?

name: CONCLUSION_COMMENTS
label:
### Result comments
Any comments regarding (the coding of) this result?

name: EXPLOR_RESEARCHQ
label: How many exploratory research questions are investigated?

name: EXPLOR_ANALYSES
label: How many exploratory analyses are calculated?

name: GENERAL_HYP_COUNT
label: How many preregistered, confirmatory hypotheses are reported in total?

name: GENERAL_HYP_CODING
Description: Did you code all preregistered confirmatory hypotheses in this article?
label: Did you code all preregistered confirmatory hypotheses in this article?

name: GENERAL_COMMENTS
label: General comments:
